data.what_is:
Listrak is the retail industry's leading customer engagement platform. Listrak delivers results for more than 1,000 retailers by providing best-in-class email, text message marketing, identity resolution marketing and push notifications through seamless cross-channel orchestration. 

Listrak's data-first approach delivers 1:1 personalization at scale so you can send messages at precisely the right time across the right combination of channels and devices to maximize customer engagement, revenue, and lifetime value.
data.product_description: An integrated marketing platform built for retailers to drive results: increased engagement, revenue and loyalty at every point of interaction.

initial_reviews.review_title: Listrak is an excellent addition to Marketing Tactics
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Listrak?
Listrak has many great features such as:
* being able to set up very targeted delivery through profiles and audiences
* setting up automated workflows in which emails are triggered to deploy when a client's customer performs a specified actions, such as browsing a page or adding and item to their cart,
* Platform that offers easy way to set up and design Email blasts.

However, I think the best part about Listrak is its robust reporting that can be checked through dashboards and various exported reports. Not to mention the absolutely throrough attentive support Listrak provides every month.

Listrak works for all different type of businesses such as a client that would use emails frequently to the client that wouold only want to send a few emails a month and is very easy to use.

It was very easy to implement Listrak into the other marketing tactics. They provide quite a few training tools as well as offer on call support.

Finally they worked well with IT in getting it set up in a timely fashion

We would strongly recommend Listrak to any company in need of an email marketing platform.

What do you dislike about Listrak?
We have had several service providers in the past that were not supportive. However, after bringing this to the attention of Listrak they quickly changed our point of support to an individual that is very thorough, helpful and wants companies to grow and be successuful by using the Listrak product.

What problems is Listrak solving and how is that benefiting you?
Listrak is helping us with setting up our automated emails, in which we weren't fully taking advantage of until recently.

initial_reviews.review_title: Listrak
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Listrak?
I have personally never worked on an ESP, or general marketing platform, that had better customer service or technical support. Their help chat module within the platform has been an easy go-to feature to use whenever I am pulling reports, scheduling emails, or building an automated campaign and I have a question or an issue that needs a quick solution. Every technical ticket that my team has submitted through our account manager has been addressed with a fully competent and prepared team who understands the issue and are looking to find the best solution. No platform or tool is perfect, and there are inevitable road-blocks that arise when working on new campaigns or looking to improve and optimize engagement. What sets Listrak apart for me is the accessibility to their team, whether it's solution experts or the very people working on the backend, optimizing their platform. My team is currently in the midst of a website re-platforming, and a huge integration like that is very daunting both on our end, and with all of the vendors we are partnered with; Listrak has by far been very prepared and ready to uphold their end of the integration, which is a huge weight off of my shoulders so far.

What do you dislike about Listrak?
I think there are a few tools across the platform, such as: reporting, contact profiles, a fully integrated analytics dashboard for email, sms and automated campaigns, and the cross channel journey tools that can be more sophisticated or accessible. I struggle with the Lists feature in the platform when trying to pull reporting across the entire platform and all my contacts. Unfortunately, their reporting and data is very centered and enclosed within singular "Lists". I understand to a certain extent why this is built this way, but it would be nice to be able to have separate lists as well as the option for combined reporting for an easy and full view of complete platform performance. Also, having been on the platform for almost three years now, I still have trouble with navigation, some things are not always where'd you expect to find them, and navigating isn't always the most intuitive. I think there is always room for more advanced optimization of Listrak's features and solutions, but everything that would be expected from a good marketing ESP is available and ready-to-use. Ultimately there is always an entire support team ready to help you accomplish whatever your goal is.

What problems is Listrak solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have been working with Listrak for some time now in optimizing our personalization and email recommendations solution as well as our alerts suite. It's definitely a benefit to have the Listrak team working on this since a lot of the issues we've been facing involve other vendors, or how our feeds have been set up - these issues are technically out of Listrak's control but they have been doing their best to work around any shortcomings we've faced and utlimately with an upcoming integration and replatforming we should be ready to execute on these tasks.

initial_reviews.review_title: Trust in the Powerful Listrak CRM!
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Listrak?
As an email marketing manager, I love how easy it is to build emails in composer and also look at main KPIs in the message history/performance summary with ease. I also really love how we have an account manager who helps identify areas of oppportunity for the program. Meg Kunkle has gone above and beyond to help our program reach greater heights. She's hardworking, empathetic, passionate and funny! She's one of the best account managers I've ever had the pleasure of working with.As someone who works as an email marketing manager, I find it really convenient to use Composer to create emails, and then review the main KPIs in the message history / performance summary. Additionally, having an account manager who can help identify opportunities for program improvement has been incredibly helpful. Specifically, Meg Kunkle has gone above and beyond to help our program achieve greater success. She is a hardworking, empathetic, passionate, and funny individual. In fact, I would say that she is one of the best account managers I have ever worked with.

What do you dislike about Listrak?
I don't like how I can't have two tabs open at the same time to easily reference things. I would like to work quicker in the platform as I manage email campaigns for US and CA but that option is not available right now.

What problems is Listrak solving and how is that benefiting you?
Listrak is helping us communicate with our customers at the right time with the right messaging. It's a powerful automation CRM that can stand toe to toe with its competitors. Email marketing is the top channel for Worx, as it brings in the most web traffic and revenue.

If you need a platform that acutally is going to work with your ROI is easy to integrate, go find another one.

They filled a gap when Bronto twilighted, that gap fill was about the only thing that Listrak has ended up solving and that has directly benifited our company so far.

initial_reviews.review_title: Listrak is a great full-service marketing platform
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Listrak?
I love that we have a dedicated Account Manager who supports our account. She's a rockstar who pushes through our requests and tracks any support tickets or tickets placed with GXP. In addition, GXP makes automated campaigns easy to implement and maintain. Listrak Support is also quick to get back to me when I need help with anything.

What do you dislike about Listrak?
I don't like that the platform isn't built well for self-service. With other platforms, like Hubspot, I could set up automated campaigns in seconds, but in Listrak, I need the Account Manager or support to help me get them set up. It's also much easier/faster to set up integrations in other platforms but in Listrak, it has taken over 6 months to get two data fields into the system.
There are also funky things in the platform like Conversations vs. Journey Builder - Journey Builder looks like it would be easier to use than Conversations but I keep hearing that we shouldn't move over to it yet. My question is why is it live in the system if employees don't want to use it yet?
I also think the navigation of the platform is confusing - there are way too many options and pages could easily be consolidated.
It's also strange that we can't build a custom dashboard to view reports - I get my reports weekly from our Account Manager and it's in a giant spreadsheet with a ton of tabs. It's helpful data but I'd like to view the reports/graphs that are important to me at any time - not once a week when it's emailed to me.
When it comes to the lists, it bothers me that the data on lists are separate and it takes extra steps to get it all in sync. If I collect a customer's first name or their pet's names for example, I want that information tied to their email address available on all lists.
If I want to send a dedicated email to a subset of customers pulled from a different source, instead of creating a list for those contacts, it's easier to create a new profile field to track them, which is strange and it's why we have a bunch of old profile fields that need to be cleaned up.

What problems is Listrak solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's nice having a full-service team that implements many of the things we want.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Listrak?
I have personally never worked on an ESP, or general marketing platform, that had better customer service or technical support. Their help chat module within the platform has been an easy go-to feature to use whenever I am pulling reports, scheduling emails, or building an automated campaign and I have a question or an issue that needs a quick solution. Every technical ticket that my team has submitted through our account manager has been addressed with a fully competent and prepared team who understands the issue and are looking to find the best solution. No platform or tool is perfect, and there are inevitable road-blocks that arise when working on new campaigns or looking to improve and optimize engagement. What sets Listrak apart for me is the accessibility to their team, whether it's solution experts or the very people working on the backend, optimizing their platform. My team is currently in the midst of a website re-platforming, and a huge integration like that is very daunting both on our end, and with all of the vendors we are partnered with; Listrak has by far been very prepared and ready to uphold their end of the integration, which is a huge weight off of my shoulders so far.

What do you dislike about Listrak?
I think there are a few tools across the platform, such as: reporting, contact profiles, a fully integrated analytics dashboard for email, sms and automated campaigns, and the cross channel journey tools that can be more sophisticated or accessible. I struggle with the Lists feature in the platform when trying to pull reporting across the entire platform and all my contacts. Unfortunately, their reporting and data is very centered and enclosed within singular "Lists". I understand to a certain extent why this is built this way, but it would be nice to be able to have separate lists as well as the option for combined reporting for an easy and full view of complete platform performance. Also, having been on the platform for almost three years now, I still have trouble with navigation, some things are not always where'd you expect to find them, and navigating isn't always the most intuitive. I think there is always room for more advanced optimization of Listrak's features and solutions, but everything that would be expected from a good marketing ESP is available and ready-to-use. Ultimately there is always an entire support team ready to help you accomplish whatever your goal is.

What problems is Listrak solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have been working with Listrak for some time now in optimizing our personalization and email recommendations solution as well as our alerts suite. It's definitely a benefit to have the Listrak team working on this since a lot of the issues we've been facing involve other vendors, or how our feeds have been set up - these issues are technically out of Listrak's control but they have been doing their best to work around any shortcomings we've faced and utlimately with an upcoming integration and replatforming we should be ready to execute on these tasks.

all_reviews.review_title: Listrak is a great full-service marketing platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Listrak?
I love that we have a dedicated Account Manager who supports our account. She's a rockstar who pushes through our requests and tracks any support tickets or tickets placed with GXP. In addition, GXP makes automated campaigns easy to implement and maintain. Listrak Support is also quick to get back to me when I need help with anything.

What do you dislike about Listrak?
I don't like that the platform isn't built well for self-service. With other platforms, like Hubspot, I could set up automated campaigns in seconds, but in Listrak, I need the Account Manager or support to help me get them set up. It's also much easier/faster to set up integrations in other platforms but in Listrak, it has taken over 6 months to get two data fields into the system.
There are also funky things in the platform like Conversations vs. Journey Builder - Journey Builder looks like it would be easier to use than Conversations but I keep hearing that we shouldn't move over to it yet. My question is why is it live in the system if employees don't want to use it yet?
I also think the navigation of the platform is confusing - there are way too many options and pages could easily be consolidated.
It's also strange that we can't build a custom dashboard to view reports - I get my reports weekly from our Account Manager and it's in a giant spreadsheet with a ton of tabs. It's helpful data but I'd like to view the reports/graphs that are important to me at any time - not once a week when it's emailed to me.
When it comes to the lists, it bothers me that the data on lists are separate and it takes extra steps to get it all in sync. If I collect a customer's first name or their pet's names for example, I want that information tied to their email address available on all lists.
If I want to send a dedicated email to a subset of customers pulled from a different source, instead of creating a list for those contacts, it's easier to create a new profile field to track them, which is strange and it's why we have a bunch of old profile fields that need to be cleaned up.

What problems is Listrak solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's nice having a full-service team that implements many of the things we want.

The ability to target blocks of products to certain users, based on their behaviors and buying habits, and have this custom content specific to each user, has let us realize growth in sales since we switched to Listrak in late 2019. The Recommended Products blocks have allowed us to target based on behavior and buying, plus a system-determined propensity to More Likely or Most Likely to buy. We have also targeted base on Brand Affinity to ensure that power tools fans see power tools, and not our other categories of products.

You think they would want to integrate more seamlessly with the largest ecommerce platform on the market. Competitors let you do month to month payments, because they know their service speaks for itself. but Listrak locks you in and never lets go unless you read all the fine print. Yes, I should have read the fine print a bit more closely, but they could have done the right thing and let us out if we weren't happy after several years and tens of thousands in their pockets.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Listrak?
Listrak has several common out-of-the-box solutions that they create for you provided that they have all the data and assets necessary. This includes SCA, welcome series, an alerts suite, and more. These are solutions that you'll want to stand up for your email program and Listrak makes it really easy to do so. The analytics are pretty in-depth and give great insight into KPIs. They're definitely working to improve the platform regularly, and if you want to do something that the platform can't do just yet, they'll usually guide you on a workaround. They also have a great feature that offers predictive audiences who are most likely to open, purchase, click, etc. and we've seen success from using these audiences. The message editor is drag and drop and makes it very easy to build messages, but it also offers an HTML component to add any custom sections. There are dynamic elements available based on segments, which is another big win. Their account managers are very attentive and really want to make sure that you use the platform to its full potential, which is appreciated.

What do you dislike about Listrak?
Some parts of the platform that should connect don't, specifically pertaining to analytics. Setting up triggers is complicated and almost always requires the seal of approval from your Listrak rep to make sure that it's set up correctly. They've tried to improve this with workflows, which definitely are an improvement, but it's not quite there yet. The audience builder is slow and has to reload every time something is added.

Recommendations to others considering Listrak:
If you're looking for a new ESP, I definitely recommend Listrak. They're always looking for ways to improve, offer great value and knowledge to their clients, and can help stand up or grow your email program.

What problems is Listrak solving and how is that benefiting you?
Listrak helped us to stand up our back in stock alerts that was a new feature for us. Having this campaign running has helped us achieve a new level of transparency with our customers during this unprecedented time.

all_reviews.review_title: An innovative company with great support and customer service who listens to their customers.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Listrak?
Our company has been using Listrak since moving from a prior ESP in 2014. Our main reasons for switching to Listrak was to improve upon the prior ESP's shortcommings. At Listrak we found improved (and faster) reporting, an easier to use automated workflow tool and improved customer service. Besides these improvements, Listrak brought experience in the ecommerce category. The majority of our revenue is generated through ecommerce related email. Besides using Listrak for ecommerce emails we also send regular editorial newsletters and emails on behalf of our sponsors.

Listrak's back-end tools are the best we've used vs the three other vendors we have experienced. We currently use another ESP for one of our brands (required because of a third-party arrangment) and we wish we could switch from that system to Listrak which is far easier to use. We find the back-end systems easy to manage. The Composer tool was a huge improvment over their already useful editor. Our digital team are experienced coders, however the Composer greatly reduced the time to design email with it's simple drag/drop platform. It also allowed less sophisticated folks (like me) to quickly and easily create emails. The segmenting/audience tool is simple and intuitive (they have recently launched a new interface which makes it even easier to use).

Listrak's technical support team is easily accessible via chat, phone or email and they respond quickly.

Along the way we've added several of Listrak's solutions: email capture, product recommender and SMS. These have proven effective in driving revenue and growing our list.


In summary, Listrak is innovative, listens to customer needs, has a high-touch customer service and support team and highly values their relationships with their clients. They are a good vendor and partner for our business.

What do you dislike about Listrak?
The new email capture system (Pop-up Pro) is a significant improvement over the previous mechanism but it really could use additional features like A/B testing.

We had one experience with their strategic services 4 years ago and it just didn't work well for us. Despite that experience, I've been told they have new team members and we're set to try them again in the next month.

Recommendations to others considering Listrak:
Very strong ecommerce experience.

What problems is Listrak solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were looking to increase revenue utilizing "Recommender" and email capture systems far exceeded our goals within the first year. Since we started with Listrak our list of engaged subscribers has grown by 704%. Our revenue from email has grown 352%.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Listrak?
I love their CRM tool which enables you to view data on your segments and right click on any graph to automate that segment for future marketing. I also love their drag and drop journey building tool. It is easy to use, pause, and update our journeys.

In addition, their account team is extremely responsive, professional, and creative at solving our organization's marketing problems. Jon Sanville has been an excellent account manager who has been able to help us take our brands into the future with personalization.

What do you dislike about Listrak?
Accessing raw database data is not easy. Other marketing/CRM platforms enable us to use SQL to access the raw data. Listrak requires us to go through their support department, especially on large queries.

Recommendations to others considering Listrak:
Listrak performs extremely well when you utilize it as a data warehouse for your organization. I'd recommend enabling product data, consumer browse data, transaction data, content data, and other CRM data within the platform. This enables you to utilize their dynamic recommendation tools in email and other consumer communications.

What problems is Listrak solving and how is that benefiting you?
We're able to answer questions about how specific, defined audiences are performing vs. our entire list in their CRM tool. We can then activate and personalize their journey immediately using Listrak's journey builder.

all_reviews.review_title: Intuitive Design Makes Automated and Marketing Emails a Breeze
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Listrak?
Listrak's email builder, Compser, is easy to use and provides more customer behavior metrics with the list health and message activity dashboards than any other platform I've worked on. It's easy to compare year over year creative with the different kinds of heat maps and where people are opening the emails and where they unsubscribe (desktop, mobile, or other). I also like how patient my rep is with me and how she is always explaining things to me, sometimes more than once!

What do you dislike about Listrak?
I dislike audience filter phrasing (subscribe date is after 3 months ago), having to completely rebuild HTML emails in the new email builder - that there's not a way they just convert. I wish I could change the design more between desktop and mobile other than rearranging blocks. Also, our GA numbers never match up with the Listrak revenue. Sometimes the Listrak words get confusing like "recipes" and "conversations" or "segmented field groups."

Recommendations to others considering Listrak:
Do it! More analytics than Klayvio and better support than Constant Contact. Between your rep and support you can't go wrong. I always feel like an individual, they never send me automated blanket answers to my questions. They really feel like an extension of the company I work for, and not an outside vendor.

What problems is Listrak solving and how is that benefiting you?
Listrak is helping with advanced segmentation - allowing us to really split up what flows (they call it conversations)  people receive based on what they've purchased, what they click on, and where they live. They're also really helpful with setting up A/B split tests - which is something I haven't done a lot of in the past. Our rep will also look into some of the conversations for us and help me update them, or see where we could add or delete emails to really optimize the conversion rate.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Listrak?
While I really enjoy Listrak's user-friendly dashboard, I enjoy working with their reps the most. There is a focus on customer satisfaction through human interaction that is very welcomed in this age of increased automation.
The on-boarding experience with Listrak was painless and it went very smoothly. Every rep that we've had there (currently only 2)  has managed our account with precision and care. I was also very impressed by the way in which, when it was time to change reps mid-stream (because our rep had gotten a promotion), they utilized shadowing and had an overlap so that the transition was seamless.

What do you dislike about Listrak?
I find that the Listrak dash - and it's capabilities are so deep that I do not always have the time to play with it as often as I'd like to. Also, at times, because the subtle nuances of what you are able to accomplish are so varied, it can get a bit complex for the layman - mapping triggered conversations for example. Luckily, Listrak's support team is always there to provide guidance.

Recommendations to others considering Listrak:
Call them up and talk through what you would like to accomplish. Judge them by how they answer you questions. When we were vetting the other options offered out there - and there were many choices to choose from, we were impressed with Listrak, as a brand, from start to finish.

I would also like to recommend Listrak's events that are held from time to time. This is where they act like true partners and share their roadmap for the future and let you in to their world. These events are very professional and I always walk away with more info than I initially had.

What problems is Listrak solving and how is that benefiting you?
Currently, we are working with our rep Cody to really fine tune our automated campaigns such as welcome, abandonment and the like. He acts more like a member of our team in the way in which he takes the time to bring new strategies to the table and also helps us when we hit a roadblock. This level of collaboration has been a huge benefit to our team, which is oftentimes stretched very thin.

all_reviews.review_title: Listrak trumps competition with their superior Analytics system
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Listrak?
Listrak is my #1 go to digital marketing automation platform. Their contact, conversion, and message analytics are far superior to many other platforms I have used. Additionally, they provide automated features such as model acquisition & shopping cart abandonment. Their platform can be easily integrated into your website, which provides data & information prudent to connecting with your customers on more personal level. Lastly, Listrak offers convenient tools such as Coupon Manager ... which allows you to generate Barcodes & QR codes and returns the analytics on this feature.

What do you dislike about Listrak?
There are very few aspects I dislike about Listrak, but one important tool that is inferior to its competition is their version of a Drag & Drop editor: Composer.  Although it is a great step up from their previous WYSIWYG editor, Composer lacks many basic design tools that other digital marketing platforms offer. As email code/design is my forte, this doesn't necessarily affect me in a negative manner. But ... if coding emails isn't your strong point, then the lack of design features and outdated templates could be bothersome. Last, I also dislike that code cannot be imported, exported, or manually written while using Composer to design a campaign.

Recommendations to others considering Listrak:
Great if you have a large database and are looking to increase customer engagement. Additionally, the various analytic systems available with Listrak are far superior too much of their competition. It's a plus if you can write code & design emails, because their Drag & Drop editor lacks full design capabilities in order to create interesting and unique campaigns.

What problems is Listrak solving and how is that benefiting you?
The main problem I initially addressed was our lack of customer engagement & personalization in our past campaigns. Listrak provided tools that produced data to better understand our customer base. Features that track individuals buying trends or past purchases allowed me to curate automated campaigns that would suggest products specific to previous subscribers click or search history. Also, recognizing the customer by name and knowing the state they reside in helped boost our ability to connect with them on a more personal level. By doing so, this triggered benefits such as higher conversion rates and increase in customer satisfaction.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Listrak?
As a designer, the biggest difference I've noticed from our past email provider is the streamlined dashboard and increase in images. The ability to see an image of the sent email along with detailed results help refresh my visual memory of my designs. Additionally, the heat map is excellent for measuring what is and is not grabbing our audiences attention.

I have been in contact with Listrak support a few times and my questions have always been answered and problems resolved. Once, trying to schedule and email at 11pm on a Sunday night from home, I contacted the support team for assistance and while the problem eventually resolved itself. I still received both a follow-up call and email explaining what had happened and double checking that all was resolved.

What do you dislike about Listrak?
I occasionally leave the Google Analytics Campaign Name box blank. It would be nice if there was a reminder for skipped boxes. While these sort of pop-up reminders can sometimes be annoying, they can also save you in the long run!

Also, between the dashboard and message history and/or split test results, there are multiple ways to track an email's success. My bosses and I are occasionally looking at different screens showing various results (i.e. clicks, opens, and reads in one place and click rate and open rate percentages in another that don't always seem to sync up).

What problems is Listrak solving and how is that benefiting you?
The split testing has allowed us to measure response to different subject lines and email designs. This allows us to gauge what works best for our customers.

The multi-pass has been extremely successful in getting our emails into the mailboxes of people who may have missed them the first time, and we have seen an increase in sales because of it.
